quiz.label: Conflict
quiz.q: Does this information conflict with an otherwise established or ‘official’ narrative?

quiz.label: Heightened language
quiz.q: When this information was presented, did it use highly charged language that suggests you are about to ‘wake up’ and discover something that you would not believe or did not know before?

quiz.label: Connecting the unconnected
quiz.q: Does this information link seemingly unrelated world events together into a single narrative?

quiz.label: Heroic figure
quiz.q: Was this information presented by, or does it describe an ‘ideal leader’ or spokesperson of a social movement?

quiz.label: Sheeple
quiz.q: Are the people that dismiss or ignore this information described as blindly following the herd and conforming to the official narrative?

quiz.label: Good/evil
quiz.q: Does this information present the circumstances in question as ‘good vs. evil’ or ‘us vs. them’?

quiz.label: Definition
quiz.q: Does this information suggest that there is a small group of people secretly ‘pulling the strings’ of an event(s) for nefarious gains?

quiz.label: Grand narrative
quiz.q: Does this information form part of a greater, dramatic narrative that can be used to explain a wide array of large-scale events?

quiz.label: Many pieces of weak evidence
quiz.q: Does this information draw on a wide range of partial or weak sources to inform its narrative?

quiz.label: Certainty
quiz.q: Does this information provide you with a sense of certainty about a situation that is otherwise ambiguous or hard to understand?

quiz.label: Intuition
quiz.q: Does this information seem to just ‘feel right’, based on ‘gut feelings’?

quiz.label: Conjunction fallacy
quiz.q: Does this information detail how there was an orchestrated intention or conspiracy behind an event that was otherwise assumed to have naturally occurred or occurred by accident?

quiz.label: Lack of intellectual humility
quiz.q: Does this information require the comprehension of complex information or data that you are not experienced in interpreting?

quiz.label: Uniqueness
quiz.q: Does this information claim to hold unique and coveted knowledge?

quiz.label: Blame outgroups
quiz.q: Does this information detail how a group that you are usually not very fond of is responsible for the shortcomings of a group that you often care deeply about?

quiz.label: Social exclusion
quiz.q: If you were to publicly support this information, would you expect to experience some ‘push-back’ or social exclusion?

quiz.label: External threat
quiz.q: Does this information refer to a large-scale global/political event that poses a threat to the world’s population?

quiz.label: Internal threat
quiz.q: Does this information confirm and explain anxieties you held previously?

quiz.label: Catastrophizing
quiz.q: Does this information explain how something that most people would not frequently consider in their day-to-day lives is actually much more dangerous and dramatic than they would have otherwise thought?

quiz.label: Can it be disproved?
quiz.q: Does this information explain how something that most people would not frequently consider in their day-to-day lives is actually much more dangerous and dramatic than they would have otherwise thought?
